Class WZPlayerView

  • java.lang.Object
    • FrameLayout
      • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.player.WZPlayerView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WZPlayerAPI.WZAudioStreamReceiver, WZPlayerAPI.WZVideoStreamReceiver

extends FrameLayout
implements WZPlayerAPI.WZVideoStreamReceiver, WZPlayerAPI.WZAudioStreamReceiver

      • isReadyToPlay

        public boolean isReadyToPlay()
        Indicates if the player is in state where play can be initiated
        Returns:
        true if the player is ini a stopped or paused state, false otherwise

      • play

        public void play(WZPlayerConfig playerConfig,
                 WZStatusCallback statusCallback)
        Start playback using the specified stream configuration. The onStatus() method of the status callback will be invoked with the state set to WZState.RUNNING when complete.
        Parameters:
        playerConfig - the stream configuration to activate

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop playback. The onStatus() method of the status callback will be invoked with the state set to WZState.IDLE when complete.

      • stop

        public void stop(WZStatusCallback statusCallback)
        Stop playback. The onStatus() method of the status callback will be invoked with the state set to WZState.IDLE when complete.

      • sendDataEvent

        public void sendDataEvent(WZDataScope eventScope,
                          String eventName,
                          WZDataMap eventParams,
                          WZDataEvent.ResultCallback resultCallback)
        Send a data event with the specified scope, name, parameters, and result callback.
        Parameters:
        eventScope - One of WZDataScope.STREAM or WZDataScope.MODULE, the scope to which the event applies. Note that if eventScope is WZDataScope.STREAM the resultCallback parameter must be null
        eventName - The name of the event to send
        eventParams - A name/value pair hash map of the event's parameters
        resultCallback - An implementation of the WZDataEvent.ResultCallback interface whose WZDataEvent.ResultCallback#onWZDataEventResult method will be invoked upon receiving a resulting response from the server.

      • sendDataEvent

        public void sendDataEvent(WZDataScope eventScope,
                          String eventName,
                          WZDataEvent.ResultCallback resultCallback)
        Send a data event with the specified scope, name, and result callback. s
        Parameters:
        eventScope - One of WZDataScope.STREAM or WZDataScope.MODULE, the scope to which the event applies. Note that if eventScope is WZDataScope.STREAM the resultCallback parameter must be null
        eventName - The name of the event to send
        resultCallback - An implementation of the WZDataEvent.ResultCallback interface whose WZDataEvent.ResultCallback#onWZDataEventResult method will be invoked upon receiving a resulting response from the server.

        Parameters:

      • getStreamStats

        public WZDataMap getStreamStats()

      • sendPingRequest

        public void sendPingRequest(WZDataEvent.ResultCallback resultCallback)
        Sends a ping request to the server and returns the result to the specified callback. The result, in milliseconds, will be available in a property named responseTime present in the parameters sent to the resultCallback
        Parameters:
        resultCallback - A callback to be invoked with the results of the request. The responseTime property of the result parameters passed to the callback will contain the response time, in milliseconds.
